description: This file contains the implementation of POSIX date and time parsing functions, including parsing logic for touch and date commands, definitions for parsing date strings, and related helper functions. It notably includes the posixtime() function, which converts string representations of dates into time_t values, and a test suite guarded by #ifdef TEST_POSIXTIME.

methods.name: int year(struct tm * tm,const int * digit_pair,size_t n,unsigned int syntax_bits)
methods.description: Helper function to parse year information from date strings, adjusting the tm_year field based on the digits and syntax bits.

methods.name: int posix_time_parse(struct tm * tm,const char * s,unsigned int syntax_bits)
methods.description: Parses a date string into a tm structure based on POSIX formats, considering leading/trailing year info and seconds.

methods.name: bool posixtime(time_t * p,const char * s,unsigned int syntax_bits)
methods.description: Converts a date string into a time_t value using POSIX-compliant parsing rules, with validation and error checking.

ctags.name: posix_time_parse
ctags.pattern: /^posix_time_parse (struct tm *tm, const char *s, unsigned int syntax_bits)$/
ctags.signature: (struct tm * tm,const char * s,unsigned int syntax_bits)

ctags.name: year
ctags.pattern: /^year (struct tm *tm, const int *digit_pair, size_t n, unsigned int syntax_bits)$/
ctags.signature: (struct tm * tm,const int * digit_pair,size_t n,unsigned int syntax_bits)
